title: Sterling rises after UK lawmakers win bid to try to block no-deal Brexit
text:
Sterling rises after UK lawmakers win bid to try to block no-deal Brexit

Forex 1 hour ago (Sep 04, 2019 02:56AM ET)

LONDON (Reuters) - Sterling gained in early London trading on Wednesday, as investors gave a cautious welcome to British lawmakers success in seizing control of parliamentary time to try and block a no-deal Brexit. Sterling, which on Tuesday fell below $1.20 and to its weakest in three-years, rose 0.4% to the day's high of $1.2129 . Against the euro it rallied 0.3% to 90.53 pence ( ). Lawmakers who defeated Prime Minister Boris Johnson's government late on Tuesday are expected to introduce a bill in parliament on Wednesday seeking to stop Britain from leaving the European Union on Oct. 31 without transitional arrangements.

Sterling rises after UK lawmakers win bid to try to block no-deal Brexit
description: Sterling rises after UK lawmakers win bid to try to block no-deal Brexit
